name: African Violet (Saintpaulia ionantha)
description: Small, flowering houseplant with fuzzy, round leaves that grow in a rosette pattern. Flowers are often purple, pink, or white, blooming year-round.
curiosity: These are sensitive to cold water and can develop brown spots on their leaves if watered from above.

name: Alocasia (Elephant Ear)
description: Tropical plant known for its dramatic, large, often arrow-shaped leaves with prominent veining. Needs high humidity.
waterFrequency: Keep consistently moist (check every few days)
curiosity: Some Alocasia varieties go dormant in winter and may lose all their leaves, but they will regrow in spring.

name: Aloe Vera
description: Succulent plant species known for its medicinal properties. Features thick, fleshy, spiky leaves that contain a clear gel.
exposition: Full sun or bright, indirect light
curiosity: The clear gel inside the leaves is widely used to soothe burns and cuts.

name: Anthurium (Anthurium andraeanum)
description: Tropical plant known for its colorful, waxy, heart-shaped 'flowers' (spathes) and prominent central spikes (spadix).
curiosity: The colorful part is not a flower; it's a modified leaf called a spathe, which protects the true flower spike.

name: Areca Palm (Dypsis lutescens)
description: A graceful indoor palm with arching, feathery fronds. A popular air-purifying plant that adds a tropical feel.
waterFrequency: Weekly (Keep soil lightly moist in summer)
soilType: Standard potting mix with added sand or peat
curiosity: They are sometimes called 'Butterfly Palms' because their fronds curve upward, resembling butterfly wings.

name: Asparagus Fern (Asparagus setaceus)
description: A delicate-looking plant with light, feathery, needle-like foliage. It is technically not a fern, but a member of the lily family.
waterFrequency: Weekly (Water thoroughly when soil is dry to the touch)
curiosity: Despite its soft appearance, the stems can have small, sharp spines. Keep away from pets and children.

name: Begonia (Begonia spp.)
description: Large and diverse group of plants known for their decorative leaves and colorful flowers.
curiosity: Some begonias are grown purely for their leaves rather than flowers.

name: Bird of Paradise (Strelitzia reginae)
description: Striking tropical plant with large, banana-like leaves and exotic flowers resembling birds in flight.
exposition: Bright light, including some direct sun
curiosity: It can take several years before a Bird of Paradise blooms indoors.

name: Birds Nest Fern (Asplenium nidus)
description: Fern with broad, wavy fronds that grow in a rosette shape, resembling a bird’s nest.
curiosity: Water should be applied to the soil, not the center rosette.

name: Boston Fern (Nephrolepis exaltata)
description: Classic fern with arching fronds and dense foliage, commonly used as a hanging plant.
curiosity: Boston ferns are excellent natural humidifiers.

name: Calathea
description: Decorative foliage plant known for patterned leaves that move in response to light.
curiosity: Calatheas are nicknamed 'prayer plants' because their leaves fold at night.

name: Cast Iron Plant (Aspidistra elatior)
description: Extremely hardy plant with long, dark green leaves that tolerates neglect and low light.
curiosity: It earned its name because it is nearly impossible to kill.

name: Chinese Evergreen (Aglaonema)
description: Low-maintenance houseplant with patterned leaves, ideal for beginners.
curiosity: Aglaonema is known for tolerating low-light environments very well.

name: Chinese Money Plant (Pilea peperomioides)
description: Compact plant with round, coin-shaped leaves on long stems.
curiosity: It produces many baby plants that can be easily propagated.

name: Christmas Cactus (Schlumbergera bridgesii)
description: Succulent-like cactus that blooms with colorful flowers during winter.
curiosity: Flowering is triggered by shorter daylight hours.

name: Chrysanthemum
description: Flowering plants famous for their bright, multi-petaled blooms often seen in autumn.
curiosity: In many cultures, these represent longevity and rebirth.

name: Ctenanthe
description: Close relative of the Calathea, featuring striking variegated foliage.
curiosity: Like prayer plants, their leaves rise and fall with the light.

name: Daffodils (Narcissus spp.)
description: Spring-flowering perennial bulbs with bright yellow or white trumpet-shaped flowers.
curiosity: Daffodil bulbs contain toxic crystals to prevent animals from eating them.

name: Dracaena
description: Popular indoor plant with long, narrow leaves often edged in red or yellow.
curiosity: Sensitive to fluoride found in tap water.

name: Dumb Cane (Dieffenbachia spp.)
description: Large, showy houseplant with broad, variegated leaves of green, cream, and white.
curiosity: Its sap is toxic and can cause temporary loss of speech if ingested, hence the name.

name: English Ivy (Hedera helix)
description: Evergreen climbing vine with classic lobed leaves, often used for ground cover or hanging baskets.
exposition: Medium light to bright indirect light
curiosity: It uses small 'rootlets' to cling to walls and trees.

name: Hyacinth (Hyacinthus orientalis)
description: Highly fragrant spring-blooming bulbs with dense clusters of bell-shaped flowers.
curiosity: The scent of a single hyacinth can fill an entire room.

name: Iron Cross Begonia (Begonia masoniana)
description: Distinctive begonia with textured green leaves marked by a dark 'cross' in the center.
curiosity: The 'Iron Cross' name comes from the pattern's resemblance to the German medal.

name: Jade Plant (Crassula ovata)
description: Succulent with thick, woody stems and glossy oval leaves.
curiosity: Often considered a symbol of luck and prosperity.

name: Kalanchoe
description: Popular succulent with clusters of small, long-lasting bright flowers.
curiosity: They are 'short day' plants, needing long periods of darkness to rebloom.

name: Lilium (Hemerocallis)
description: Large, showy flowering plants known as Daylilies; each bloom usually lasts only one day.
curiosity: Despite the name, Daylilies are not 'true' lilies (genus Lilium).

name: Lily of the Valley (Convallaria majalis)
description: Sweetly scented woodland plant with small white, bell-shaped flowers.
curiosity: All parts of the plant are highly poisonous if ingested.

name: Money Tree (Pachira aquatica)
description: Tree-like plant with braided trunk and palmate leaves.
curiosity: Commonly associated with Feng Shui and good fortune.

name: Monstera Deliciosa (Swiss Cheese Plant)
description: Large, iconic houseplant known for its glossy, heart-shaped leaves that develop natural holes (fenestrations).
waterFrequency: Weekly (Allow soil to dry between waterings)
soilType: Chunky, airy mix (bark, perlite, and soil)
curiosity: The 'holes' in the leaves help the plant withstand winds and allow light to reach lower leaves.

name: Orchid
description: Elegant flowering plant with long-lasting blooms and aerial roots.
curiosity: Orchids can bloom for several months with proper care.

name: Parlor Palm (Chamaedorea elegans)
description: Small, slow-growing palm with delicate fronds, very popular since Victorian times.
curiosity: One of the best palms for low-light indoor conditions.

name: Peace Lily
description: Graceful plant with dark green leaves and white spathes.
curiosity: The plant visibly droops when it needs water.

name: Peperomia
description: A large genus of small, slow-growing plants with thick, succulent-like leaves.
curiosity: Related to the true black pepper plant.

name: Poinsettia (Euphorbia pulcherrima)
description: Famous holiday plant known for its bright red and green foliage.
curiosity: The 'flowers' are actually modified leaves called bracts.

name: Polka Dot Plant (Hypoestes phyllostachya)
description: Small houseplant with leaves 'spattered' with pink, white, or red spots.
curiosity: If the light is too low, the plant will lose its spotty colors.

name: Ponytail Palm (Beaucarnea recurvata)
description: Unique plant with a bulbous trunk and long, hair-like leaves.
curiosity: Despite its appearance, it is actually a succulent, not a true palm.

name: Pothos (Ivy Arum)
description: Versatile trailing vine with heart-shaped leaves, extremely easy to grow.
curiosity: Often called 'Devil's Ivy' because it is so hard to kill.

name: Prayer Plant (Maranta leuconeura)
description: Low-growing plant with striking patterned leaves that fold up at night.
curiosity: The folding movement is called nyctinasty.

name: Rattlesnake Plant (Calathea lancifolia)
description: Features long, spotted leaves with deep purple undersides.
curiosity: The markings resemble a rattlesnake's skin.

name: Rubber Plant (Ficus elastica)
description: Tree-like plant with large, thick, glossy leaves that can grow quite large.
curiosity: Its milky sap was once used to produce low-quality rubber.

name: Sago Palm (Cycas revoluta)
description: Ancient plant with stiff, feathery fronds and a textured trunk.
curiosity: It is a cycad, an ancient group of plants that predates dinosaurs.

name: Schefflera
description: Commonly called the Umbrella Tree due to the arrangement of its leaves.
curiosity: If it gets too leggy, it responds well to heavy pruning.

name: Snake Plant (Sansevieria)
description: Upright plant with stiff, sword-shaped leaves and extreme drought tolerance.
curiosity: One of the best plants for improving indoor air quality.

name: Spider Plant
description: Resilient houseplant known for its arching leaves and small plantlets.
curiosity: The baby plantlets (spiderettes) are easily propagated.

name: Succulent (General)
description: A general term for plants with thick, fleshy parts used to retain water.
exposition: Full sun or very bright light
curiosity: Overwatering is the number one killer of succulents.

name: Tradescantia
description: Fast-growing trailing plant often featuring purple or silver striped leaves.
curiosity: Very easy to grow from cuttings in just water.

name: Tulip
description: Spring bulbs with large, bell-shaped flowers in almost every color imaginable.
curiosity: Tulips will continue to grow in height even after being cut and placed in a vase.

name: Venus Flytrap
description: Carnivorous plant that catches insects with specialized 'trap' leaves.
curiosity: The trap only snaps shut when tiny hairs are triggered twice.

name: Yucca
description: Tough, drought-tolerant plant with sword-like leaves and a woody trunk.
curiosity: In the wild, they are pollinated exclusively by the Yucca moth.

name: ZZ Plant (Zamioculcas zamiifolia)
description: Slow-growing plant with glossy leaves and high drought resistance.
curiosity: Stores water in underground rhizomes.
